Record date: 2083-11-01
June 6, 2083
Vincent Ventura, M.D. 0758 Edmatteric Drive Cheney, TX 37523
Re: Peggy Tinsley MR# 236-67-03-3
Dear Dr. Ventura:
Peggy Tinsley was seen in the Renal Clinic today. Her chief symptomatic complaint is severe pruritus, which has not improved much with Benadryl. She has yet to fill the prescription for Sarna lotion. Her diarrhea has improved with Imodium, and she brought in samples for cultures today. Her appetite has improved somewhat. She notes exertional fatigue and shortness of breath. Medications include Phoslo 1 tablet t.i.d., Lasix 160 mg b.i.d., Altase 2.5 mg b.i.d., Lopressor 100 mg b.i.d., NPH 10 units q.d., iron t.i.d.
On examination, weight was 46.8 kilos, which is stable. Heart rate was 72, blood pressure 130/64. JVP was clearly seen at 6 cm greater than the sternal angle, and there was 1 plus peripheral edema. There was no S3. Chest examination revealed bibasilar inspiratory crackles. Her left hand is no longer cold, but the PTFE graft remains slightly edematous.
Blood work from May 30th showed a hematocrit of 23, potassium 5.2, bicarbonate 15, BUN 91, creatinine 7.9, calcium 5.5., phosphate 5.2, albumin 3.4.
We will continue to hold off on dialysis until such time as Peggy's PTFE graft is suitable. This will save her the additional morbidity of a semipermanent IJ catheter. She is more hypervolemic than last week, and I added Zaroxolyn 2.5 mg in the morning to her diuretic regimen. By oversight, she was not started on Rocaltrol, and I have started her on Rocaltrol .25 mcg p.o. q.d., and Nephrocaps 1 p.o. q.d.
Page 2 Vincent Ventura, M.D. Re: Peggy Tinsley MR# 236-67-03-3 June 6, 2083
A follow-up appointment was arranged in one week's time.
Yours sincerely,
Keith Quant, M.D. Renal Fellow
Y. Quinton Xanders, M.D.
